Ayala Malls Arca South
Remarks: The retail anchor for Arca South mixed-use development by Ayala Land in Taguig expected to be completed by 2018.[43]

Name: Ayala Malls Parklinks
Remarks: A 52,000-square-metre (560,000 sq ft) regional shopping mall being developed by the joint venture of Ayala Land and LT Group on 35 hectares (86 acres) of property along C-5 Road at the border of Quezon City and Pasig by the Marikina River.[44]

Name: Ayala Malls Southvale
Remarks: A 6,000-square-metre (65,000 sq ft) mall along Daang Hari Road in Las Piñas.[21]

Name: Deca Mall
Remarks: The retail component of Urban Deca Homes Manila, a 8.4-hectare (21-acre) mixed-use development by 8990 Holdings in Tondo, Manila.[45]

Name: Mitsukoshi Mall
Remarks: A three-level lifestyle mall to be located next to Grand Hyatt Manila below The Seasons Residences in north BGC being developed by the joint venture of Federal Land and Japanese firms Nomura Holdings and Isetan Mitsukoshi Holdings that will house the first Mitsukoshi department store in the Philippines. Expected completion in 2021.[46]

Name: Westside Mall
Remarks: The retail component of Megaworld Corporation's Westside City, a 31-hectare (77-acre) mixed-use development in Parañaque that will also house the fourth integrated resort of Entertainment City called Westside City Resorts World (previously named Resorts World Bayshore). This lifestyle mall and its casino complex is expected to start initial operations in 2021.[47]
